intro: Mitropsidium gardnerianum, commonly known as the Gardner's mitre. It is a flowering plant native to South Africa, belonging to the family Acanthaceae. The plant is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that are typically bright red or orange in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or containers. Its ornamental value has led to its cultivation in gardens beyond its native range.
